Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: dependencies and never to return and forbidding any of the mission to visit the King in person as was our custom when carrying on any important negotiation with him.

So sudden a change in the treatment of the Soba who had always protected us in every way possible to him required explanation. Negotiations continued for six weeks brought to light the following facts:

Mr Braga a Trader at Catumbella had gone to Bihé and there tried to induce the Soba to expel that part of the mission which was located there, but failed to accomplish his purpose the Soba not only refusing to send away those who were there, but inviting the whole mission to locate in his country, a thing which was under the circumstances impossible.
